1: Extract all author names mentioned. Return a clean list of names separated by commas. Remove any affiliations, numbers, or symbols.
2: Extract the authors' affiliations (universities, institutions, countries). Return a clean, concise string without filler words.
3: Identify the publisher of the journal (e.g., American Chemical Society, Royal Society of Chemistry). Do not return the journal name, only the publisher.
4: Identify the exact name of the journal where the article was published. Return just the name.
5: Extract the exact title of the article. Do not include quotes unless they are part of the title.
6: Identify the type of the article. Return a single word or short phrase (e.g., 'Research', 'Review', 'Letter').
7: Extract the year of publication. Return ONLY the 4-digit year.
8: This is a strict Yes/No question. Does the article mention having Supporting Information (SI)? Return ONLY 'Yes' or 'No'.
9: Describe the types of halide perovskite mentioned. Keep it concise (e.g., 'CsPbBr3 nanocrystals').
10: List the characterization techniques used (e.g., TEM, XRD, UV-Vis). Keep the list concise and factual.
11: This is a strict Yes/No question about whether a LIST of reagents is present. Ignore the actual reagents. Return ONLY 'Yes' or 'No'.
12: List the reagents used. Keep it concise and exclude amounts, just the names.
13: Identify the synthesis method used (e.g., 'Hot injection method'). Be brief and precise. Note if it was found in the SI.
14: Extract ONLY the amounts for METAL precursors (e.g., PbBr2, MXene, CsOA). STRICTLY EXCLUDE organic ligands (like oleic acid/OA, oleylamine/OLA) and solvents. Format as 'Material + symbology if presented: Amount'.
15: Extract ONLY the amounts of ligands used in the synthesis (e.g., Oleylamine, Oleic acid). Format as 'Ligand: Amount'.
16: Extract ONLY the amounts of solvents used in the synthesis (e.g., Octadecene, Toluene). Format as 'Solvent: Amount'.
17: List the exact degassing conditions (temperature, time, atmosphere like N2 or Vacuum).
18: List the temperature conditions used during the synthesis steps.
19: Extract the numeric reaction temperature. Return the value and unit (e.g., '150 Â°C').
20: Did the synthesis involve vacuum? give short explanation if Yes.
21: List the centrifugation conditions (rpm, time, mixture). Keep it concise.
22: Extract ONLY the RPM settings applied during centrifugation. Do not include times or solvents.
23: Identify the medium/solvent used for storing and analysis.
24: Describe the morphology and structure of the halide perovskite.
25: Describe the shape and crystalline phase of the synthesized material. Be concise (e.g., 'Cuboidal, cubic crystal structure').
26: Extract the size distribution of the halide perovskite. Provide the numeric range and unit (e.g., '4-13 nm').
27: This is a strict Yes/No question. Does the article describe photoluminescence? Return ONLY 'Yes' or 'No'.
28: Provide the specific excitation and emission wavelengths. Format clearly (e.g., 'Excitation: X nm, Emission: Y nm').
29: Extract the numeric value of PLQY (Quantum Yield). Provide the percentage or range.
30: Provide the lifetime for the halide perovskite. If not measured or not present, set is_abstained to true.
31: State the application of the material (e.g., Photovoltaic, light-emitting, photocatalysis).
32: Identify the specific material used for photocatalysis.
33: This is an A/B choice question. Output EXACTLY either 'Photocatalytic' or 'Photoelectrocatalytic'. NEVER output Yes or No.
34: Identify the solvent system used specifically for the photocatalysis process.
35: Extract the reaction time for photocatalysis.
36: Extract the amount of catalyst used for photocatalysis. Return the value and unit.
37: Describe the parameters of the light source in photocatalysis (e.g., 300 W Xe lamp).
38: Describe the degassing parameters specifically for photocatalysis.
39: List the products formed during the photocatalytic process (e.g., CO, CH4).
40: Extract the numeric yield of product CO during photocatalysis. If not measured, set is_abstained to true.
41: Extract the production rate of CO. Include value and units.
42: Extract the numeric yield of product CH4 during photocatalysis. and super short explanation. if not measured, set is_abstained to true.
43: Extract the production rate of CH4. Include value and units.
44: Extract the numeric yield of product H2 during photocatalysis. If none detected or unmeasured, state '0' or set is_abstained to true accordingly.
45: Extract the averaged electron consumption rate for the reduced product. If the text does not explicitly state it, you MUST set is_abstained to true and output 'Unmeasured'.
46: Extract the formula for the averaged electron consumption rate. If not explicitly written, set is_abstained to true.
47: Describe the selectivity of the photocatalyst. If not explicitly provided, set is_abstained to true.
48: Extract the formula of Selectivity for CO2 Reduction. If the exact formula is missing, set is_abstained to true.
49: Extract the formula of Selectivity for CH4 Reduction. If the exact formula is missing, set is_abstained to true.
